keyword: how many calories in a piece of cake
title: How Many Calories in a Piece of Cake?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a piece of cake, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs for better choices.
h1: How Many Calories in a Piece of Cake?
assumptions: Standard slice of chocolate cake with frosting, approximately 85g, baked from typical recipe.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type, size, recipe, frosting, and brand. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A standard piece of chocolate cake has about 350 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Carrot cake variation (with nuts, lower sugar)

faqs.q: How many calories in a piece of cake?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal for a standard chocolate slice with frosting.

faqs.q: What's the carb count in a piece of cake?
faqs.a: Roughly 50 g carbs, including 35 g sugars, per slice.
Only about 4 g protein per piece; it's not a high-protein food.

faqs.q: How does cake type affect calories?
faqs.a: Cheesecake or fruit cake may be lower (200-300 kcal), while layered or frosted is higher.

faqs.q: Is cake high in saturated fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 6 g saturated fat per piece from butter or cream in the recipe.
